articles.author: Bansari Kamdar, Johann Cherian
articles.description: Wall Street rose on Thursday after milder-than-feared July consumer prices data fueled hopes the Federal Reserve could leave interest rates unchanged next month.
articles.title: Wall St rallies as July inflation data fuels Fed rate pause hopes

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will highlight the U.S. economy's continuing resilience in a major speech in Las Vegas on Monday, touting the creation of 13 million new jobs and progress in driving down inflation, a Treasury official said.
articles.title: Yellen to tout U.S. economy's resilience, jobs recovery in major speech

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. consumer prices increased moderately in July as higher rents were mostly offset by declining costs of goods such as motor vehicles and furniture, a trend that could persuade the Federal Reserve to leave interest rates unchanged next month.
articles.title: US inflation cooling as consumer prices rise moderately again

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Chris Prentice
articles.description: The U.S. Treasury Department will soon propose a rule that would effectively end anonymous luxury-home purchases, closing a loophole that the agency says allows corrupt oligarchs, terrorists and other criminals to hide ill-gotten gains.
articles.title: US set to unveil long-awaited crackdown on real estate money laundering

articles.author: Alexander Marrow, Polina Devitt
articles.description: The Kremlin's fear of a serious tech brain drain is the main factor preventing Moscow from nationalising Nasdaq-listed Yandex (YNDX.O), often dubbed "Russia's Google", four people with knowledge of the company's divestment plans told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Fear of tech 'brain drain' prevents Russia from seizing Yandex for now -sources

articles.author: Aishwarya Venugopal
articles.description: Coach parent Tapestry (TPR.N) will buy Michael Kors owner Capri Holdings (CPRI.N) in a deal valued at $8.5 billion, creating a U.S. fashion powerhouse to challenge larger European rivals for a bigger share of the global luxury market.
articles.title: Coach owner's Michael Kors deal creates US giant to take on European luxury rivals

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: As inflation worries ease, U.S. stocks may need a fresh source of fuel to propel further gains this year, investors said.
articles.title: Analysis: US stock gains may grow elusive as boost from inflation slowdown wanes

articles.author: Marco Garcia
articles.description: A wildfire that swept through the picturesque resort town of Lahaina on Hawaii's Maui island has killed at least 36 people, authorities said, leaving smoldering ruins in its wake and forcing thousands to flee the devastation.
articles.title: Hawaii wildfires ravage Maui island resort city, killing dozens

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: An aide to Donald Trump pleaded not guilty on Thursday to additional federal charges that accused him of misleading investigators who were trying to recover classified documents that the former president took with him when he left office.
articles.title: Donald Trump aide pleads not guilty to new charges in US documents case

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine announced a "humanitarian corridor" in the Black Sea on Thursday to release cargo ships trapped in its ports since the outbreak of war, a new test of Russia's de facto blockade since Moscow abandoned a deal last month to let Kyiv export grain.
articles.title: Ukraine announces 'humanitarian corridor' for ships stuck in Black Sea ports
